label: Description
value: Asymmetrical cartouche decorated with branches, green leaves, and a spray of pink flowers, at right.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Representing the Liberal Arts

label: Description
value: Cartouche surmounted with head of Minerva and decorated with elements representing the liberal arts: a palette (painting); a horn, string instruments, sheets of music (music); a globe (geography); and an architect's implement (architecture).

label: Dimensions
value: Platemark: 22.2 x 19.1 cm (8 3/4 x 7 1/2 in.) Sheet: 33.5 cm (13 3/16 in.)

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Representing Architecture

label: Description
value: Cartouche representing an allegory of architecture. A young man, upper right, holds a plumb line, which is suspended from and architectural form. A ruler, compass, and architectural elements are on the ground. A mask surmounts the cartouche.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche with Pastoral Motifs

label: Description
value: Cartouche decorated with a crook tied with a bow, a horn, a shepherd's hat, two lambs, a dog, and two baskets.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Representing the Continent of Africa

label: Description
value: Asymmetrical cartouche with a giant lizard, a crocodile at top, the head of an elephant at right. Leaf and shell motifs decorate the border of the cartouche, a bow and arrow at bottom center.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Cartouche: Allegory of Fire

label: Description
value: Cartouche consisting of references to fire: a flaming torch (upper left), a flaming bottle (upper right), and a phoenix, a salamander and a mirror.

label: Dimensions
value: Platemark: 22.3 x 19 cm (8 3/4 x 7 1/2 in.) Sheet: 33 x 23.5 cm (13 x 9 1/4 in.)

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Representing the Continent of America

label: Description
value: A parrot is perched atop the asymmetrical cartouche, a bow, arrow, and horn at right, a monkey holding a long-handled fur-trimmed fan at bottom right, and a small animal at left. Leaves, flowers, and a gourd decorate the border of the cartouche.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Surmounted by a Tiger

label: Description
value: A tiger holding a thyrsus atop a barrel that is probably pouring wine, his paw resting on the head of a putto. Clusters of grapes and leaves decorate the cartouche. Enormous fish are at bottom foreground.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A cartouche configured to serve as a console. It is embellished with heads of dogs, clusters of grapes, garlands, and fruit. A fountain is at right, bottles and a large melon below. At left, a stag, a hurdy-gurdy with its horn and flags blowing in the wind.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Cartouche Forming a Bridge (Horizontal)

label: Description
value: A cartouche within a cartouche, forming a curved bridge on which a stag is pursued by two dogs. Below, a waterfall with a dog's head at center. At left, a bucket, fruit, leaves, a goose, and two heads of dogs. At right, a dog's head spouting water, to its right, a large leafy tree.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Cartouche decorated with elements of death. At top, a skull wearing a papal cap. A fatal weapon extends from a cluster of leaves above the skull. Evoking a coffin and gravesite, torches, laurel leaves, a coat of arms, and implements of a grave digger (a pick and shovel) surround the cartouche.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Cartouche Evoking the Continent of Asia

label: Description
value: Cartouche with symmetrical decoration: at top center, a crescent encircling two sprays of water; at left, a halberd (a 15th or 16th century weapon with an axe-like handle and steel blade); at right, a quiver. Entire composition framed with bouffant design, acanthus leaves and water.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design in Second Livre de Tableaux de Ornemens et Rocailles (Second Book of Ornaments and Rocailles)

label: Description
value: Fantastic architectural tree-filled landscape framed by garlands, C-curves, shells, foliage, and water fountains. On right, fountains and small dragon, nude female figure.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Ornament, Plate 17, Second Livre de tableaux d'ornemens et rocailles

label: Description
value: A framed rocaille border looking into a scene dominated by a rocaille ornament fountain, which includes shells and a mermaid, and a landscape in the distance. The scene is populated with several figures including putti. Some pour jugs of water while others stand off to the side. Water cascades down the rocaille ornaments on the left side of the frame.

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Fireplace for a Salon or the End of a Gallery

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Physical description
value: Album of engravings on off-white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux; 1921: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Two knives, their points facing downward. The carved handles show grotesque figures. At left, a woman supported by a putto kisses a human head held by a serpent-woman. At right, an oval medallion with a nude below a nude male with a cornucopia.

label: Provenance
value: From the collection of Leo Decloux (Decloux 159)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Provenance
value: From the collection of Leo Decloux (Decloux 159)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Recueil de decorations intérieures comprenant tout ce qui a rapport a l'ornement

label: Description
value: Book by Charles Percier and Pierre-François-Léonard Fontaine, "Recueil de decorations intérieures comprenant tout ce qui a rapport a l'ornement" (1801-12).

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Vue perspective de la Chambre à coucher du Cit. V à Paris (Perspective View of the Bedroom of Cit. V in Paris), plate 13, in Recueil de décorations intérieures (Collection of Interior Decorations)

label: Description
value: This image shows an interior of a bedroom.  The bed is draped and raised on a platform on the right side of the room opposite a large table with statue of a god in classical dress holding a wreath in his hand.

label: Physical description
value: Etching, engraving on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Pot-à-Oille (Design for a Tureen with Handle for the Empress Josephine), plate 46, in Recueil de decorations intérieures (Collection of Interior Decorations)

label: Description
value: Tureen on a stand decorated with garlands, cow heads, and vases, above which stands a footed tureen. Tureen ornamented with classical female figures holding cornucopia that embrace a ‘J’; handles on each side made of winged female figures. Finial made of a woman holding a vase alongside two children. Above, design of handles: two winged nude female figures with legs made of leaves support a medallion portrait of the empress with garlands.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Salle éxécuté au Chateau Malmaison (Room Designed for Chateau Malmaison), plate 55, in Recueil de decorations interieures (Collection of Interior Decorations)

label: Description
value: Room with table that has legs made of lions. Helmets, shields, swords and other trappings of war decorate the room’s interior and exterior.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Designs for Decorative Ironwork, Plate 88 from Divers dessins de balcons a plusieurs usages (Variety of Balcony Designs)

label: Description
value: A variety of designs for ironwork including gates, capitals, and friezes.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
